definition: scissors/shears/clippers/CL:把[ba3]/to cut with scissors/to trim/to wipe out or exterminate

sentences.english: He carried the newspaper back out to the kitchen and shook the hair clippings into the trash can.
sentences.chinese: 他把報紙回廚房，然後搖了搖頭髮剪報進了垃圾桶。

sentences.english: My friends in California mailed me some news clips about you.
sentences.chinese: 我在加州的朋友給我寄來了一些關於你的新聞剪報。

sentences.english: Did you read the news clips?
sentences.chinese: 你看了那些新聞剪報了嗎？

sentences.english: I had read that in an old newspaper clipping.
sentences.chinese: 我是從一張老舊的剪報中讀到這個的。

sentences.english: In the center is a newspaper clipping about Lincoln’s case.
sentences.chinese: 在牆壁中心帖的是Lincoln案的剪報。

sentences.english: 62The foreman moved his pencil towards it.
A scrapbook. Include photos and quotes and clippings and events.
sentences.chinese: 剪貼簿包含着照片，引證，剪報，和結果。

sentences.english: This is an unedited clip from an actual anti-smoking brochure.
sentences.chinese: 這是一份禁菸手冊上的剪報。

definition: lit. to return the jade annulus to Zhao (idiom); fig. to return something intact to its rightful owner
to transcribe/to make a fair copy
to read and pass on/to pass on for perusal
